events.description: Release of Japan's nominal and real wage growth data for December 2025.

facts.fact_text: Japan's nominal wages rose 2.4% year-on-year in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Japan’s nominal wages rose 2.4% year-on-year in December 2025, up from a revised 1.7% gain in November but below market expectations of 3% growth.

facts.fact_text: Base pay in Japan accelerated to 2.2% in December from 1.9% in November.

evidences.evidence_text: Base pay accelerated to 2.2% in December from 1.9% in November

facts.fact_text: Inflation-adjusted real wages fell 0.1% in December, marking 12 consecutive months of contraction.

evidences.evidence_text: inflation-adjusted real wages, a key gauge of household purchasing power, fell 0.1% in December from a year ago, marking the 12th consecutive month of contraction

claims.claim_text: The December wage reading provided little clarity on the Bank of Japan's future policy direction.

evidences.evidence_text: The reading offered little guidance on the Bank of Japan’s policy outlook

claims.claim_text: Future monetary tightening by the Bank of Japan is contingent on consistent and broad wage increases.
claims.author: Bank of Japan officials

evidences.evidence_text: officials have indicated that further monetary tightening will depend on sustained, broad-based wage gains.

evidence.evidence_text: nominal pay growth lagged slightly behind consumer inflation.
officials have indicated that further monetary tightening will depend on sustained, broad-based wage gains.
